page.title: 06A dairy farm, Lullington
page.content: Woodfields Farm, 1.6km north-east of Lullington village is a good example of a dairy farm. It is a large enterprise compared to others in the area, covering 450 acres. The farmer and his son run the business and employ 2 men and a student. Most of the land is left as permanent pasture for the 320 Friesian cows which are divided into two herds. 3 bulls are kept for breeding purposes. Artificial insemination is also being used to produce Friesian crosses with South Devons and Belgian Blues - an experiment which is hoped to improve milk quality and also produce some good beef cattle. One herd of cows is milked 3 times a day. This is done to increase milk yield. 1,600,000 litres are sold to Northern Dairies of Ashby-de-la-Zouch every year.
